citeinfo.title: KARST_CAVE_DENSITY_IN: Number of Mapped Cave Entrances per Square Kilometer in Southern Indiana (Indiana Geological Survey, Polygon Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit: This shapefile was derived from a coverage named CAVE_DENS, which, in turn, was derived from a coverage named CAVES; CAVES was used in the publication of the following maps: (1) Powell, R.L., Frushour, S.S., and Harper, D., 2002, Areas of sinkholes and sinking-stream basins, with cave locations, in southeastern Indiana, Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 64, and (2) Powell, R.L., Frushour, S.S., and Harper, D., 2002, Areas of sinkholes and sinking-stream basins, with cave locations and springs, in south-central Indiana, Indiana Geological Survey Miscellaneous Map 65.

descript.abstract: KARST_CAVE_DENSITY_IN is a polygon shapefile that shows the density (i.e., number per square kilometer) of mapped cave entrances in Silurian, Devonian, and Mississippian rocks in southern Indiana. Locations of individual cave entrances are not shown.
descript.purpose: KARST_CAVE_DENSITY_IN was derived from a coverage named CAVE_DENS. The purpose of CAVE_DENS was to provide a map layer showing the general distribution of cave entrances in southern Indiana, using unpublished data from a spreadsheet provided by Samuel S. Frushour (Indiana Geological Survey). Locations of individual cave entrances are not shown.

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcView version 3.2 shapefile format, approximately 230 Kb

attracc.attraccr: The density of cave entrances (number of entrances per square kilometer) depicted in this shapefile was determined by applying a grid with a cell size of one square kilometer across the karst region of southern Indiana. The origin of this grid was chosen arbitrarily.

dataqual.complete: According to an estimate by Samuel S. Frushour, the predecessor coverage named "CAVES" includes about 95 percent of known cave entrances. All cave entrances are large enough to allow entry by a human being; the vast majority of associated caves are more than 25 feet in length, and only a few are less than 25 feet.

horizpa.horizpar: This shapefile was derived from a coverage named CAVES, showing the locations of cave entrances in southern Indiana. No records exist regarding horizontal positional accuracy of that coverage. The coordinates used in georeferencing the cave entrances were orginally in township-range-section format and were converted into UTM Zone 16 NAD83 using Geographix software. No quantitative tests were performed.

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of KARST_CAVE_DENSITY_IN.

citeinfo.title: CAVES: Cave Entrances in Parts of Southern Indiana (Indiana Geological Survey, Point Shapefile)

srcinfo.srccontr: Locations of mapped cave entrances in southern Indiana.

procstep.procdesc: A database containing information on cave entrances in southern Indiana was compiled from 1961 to 1997 by Richard L. Powell, Richard Blenz, Kevin Komisarcik, Randy Jackson, Samuel S. Frushour, and the Indiana Cave Survey. From this database, Samuel S. Frushour (Indiana Geological Survey, IGS) provided a spreadsheet to Denver Harper (IGS). Coordinate information was converted from the Congressional Land Survey System to UTM by Charles Zuppann (IGS), using Geographix software. Denver Harper used ESRI ArcInfo 8.0.1 to create a point coverage named CAVES from the coordinate information and projected it to UTM Zone 16, NAD27.

Using ESRI ArcInfo 8.1, a fishnet polygon coverage with an arbitrarily assigned origin was created across the karst region of southern Indiana. Each polygon was one kilometer square. This fishnet coverage was opened in ESRI ArcView 3.2, together with a point coverage (named CAVES) showing the locations of cave entrances. Alex Zlotin (Indiana Geological Survey) wrote an Avenue script that counted the number of entrances in each fishnet polygon to create a coverage named CAVE_DENS.

The original coverage, CAVE_DENS, was reprojected to UTM Zone 16 NAD83. This coverage was then clipped to another coverage named INCLP83, a boundary coverage for the state of Indiana (compiled at a scale of 1:24,000). The resulting shapefile was named KARST_CAVE_DENSITY_IN.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attr.attrdef: Number of mapped cave entrances per square kilometer

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
